image.altText: A graphic showing an orange ID card with a man's photo on it and other details blurred.

props.synopsis: Data obtained in an ABC investigation shows the bulk of fines for selling illicit tobacco — tens of millions of dollars — are not being paid.

title.children: Illegal tobacco sellers leave tens of millions of fines unpaid

image.altText: A robot with a human-like face with its arms held high. Behind it is a red backdrop with white writing.

props.synopsis: There is now a global race to build humanoids that can walk, talk, reason, lift, carry, fetch, stack and generally operate in a human environment.

title.children: Humanoid robots will change work forever

image.altText: Marco Rubio, wearing a red tie and a dark suit, speaks in front of a Ukrainian flag

props.synopsis: The US and Ukraine on Sunday issued a joint statement saying they had created an "updated and refined peace framework" to end the war with Russia, apparently modifying an earlier plan drafted by the Trump administration which Kyiv and its allies saw as too sympathetic to Moscow.

title.children: Rubio touts Ukraine peace talks after Trump says Kyiv shows 'zero gratitude'

image.altText: a photo of a cyclone track map

props.synopsis: Residents in far-north WA are being warned of expected damaging wind and heavy rain today as Cyclone Fina approaches the Kimberley region.

title.children: Far-north WA residents warned to expect damaging wind and heavy rainfall

image.altText: A small group of people standing in front of a large tree fallen over by a road, as a cyclist cycles past.

props.synopsis: As a new week begins for Top End residents still recovering from the damage caused by Tropical Cyclone Fina, questions remain for many about what happens next.

title.children: What you need to know about life in Darwin in the wake of Cyclone Fina

image.altText: GettyImages-2248026288

props.synopsis: McLaren apologies to Norris and Piastri as F1 officials explain why the drivers were disqualified in Las Vegas.

title.children: What did McLaren do wrong in shock disqualification at Las Vegas GP?

image.altText: Office building entrance with sign saying Niche Living and glass doors

props.synopsis: Homes are raided and property seized as part of an ongoing investigation into embattled Perth builder Nicheliving.

title.children: Breaking: Nicheliving directors' homes raided by federal police

props.synopsis: A new face of Australia's housing crisis is emerging with companies making lucrative business out of university student tenants desperate to find somewhere to live.

title.children: 'Dirty and gross': The growing housing option operating in the 'grey area'

image.altText: Lisa Seeger uses a curling wand to curl a woman's hair.

props.synopsis: Australians are finding it harder to change jobs. It comes at a time when artificial intelligence is poised to further disrupt the workforce.

title.children: 'It's been really disheartening': The reality of trying to find a new job

image.altText: A woman stands with arms crossed in front of a bus.

props.synopsis: A Rail, Tram and Bus Union (RTBU) survey finds 73 per cent of female transport workers have suffered health issues due to inadequate toilet facilities.

title.children: Female transport workers exposed to 'horrendous', unsafe toilets on shift

image.altText: A satellite view shows water in a dam surrounded by mountains

props.synopsis: As Iran suffers through a drought and the president warns the capital could be evacuated, millions are worried about what the future will hold.

title.children: Tehran close to running dry due to 'water bankruptcy'

image.altText: A close-up of Fiona's shoulder as she sits in a chair in a room.

props.synopsis: Women are twice as likely to suffer domestic violence in Papua New Guinea compared with the rest of the world, a new report finds. Here's what the country is doing to fix it.

title.children: When women flee their husbands in PNG, they have few places to turn to

image.altText: An orange BHP logo on a grey background.

props.synopsis: Preliminary talks between miners BHP and Anglo American end without a deal. The ASX rebounds more than 1 per cent after renewed hopes of a December rate cut powered Wall Street higher. Follow the latest on our live markets blog.

title.children: BHP unable to reach takeover deal with Anglo American

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX bounces after Wall Street rally, Qube soars
Macquarie pitches an $11.6 billion takeover bid at Qube

image.altText: Sussan Ley sits in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley pays tribute to Australian women killed in acts of domestic violence in Australia in the last 12 months. Follow live.

title.children: Ley urges Australia to 'maintain the rage' on domestic, family violence

image.altText: Rent for Amanda Mentiplay stands outside her house.

props.synopsis: Data shows rental affordability in regional parts of Australia has fallen in the past year, while the situation in most capital cities has not improved.

title.children: Rental affordability worsens in regions as 'dire' situation remains

image.altText: Aerial footage of the Train's home showing two front steps and water tanks.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest does not fault police or the government for failing to pick up the curdling paranoia of the deluded Train family, but it does offer some paths forward.

title.children: Wieambilla inquest sheds light on how to prevent similar violence

image.altText: Face of blue polar bear sculpture covered in feathers

props.synopsis: Giant dancing polar bears covered in fluorescent feathers, a three-storey inflatable comic strip and a donkey in a dinghy have taken over the Art Gallery of Western Australia.

title.children: Perth exhibition exhorts visitors to hunt, be free and stay married

image.altText: Big hail

props.synopsis: Parts of Queensland will reach 45 degrees Celsius today, while the state's south east braces for severe storms.

title.children: Hail smashes south-east Queensland, with more storms forecast today

image.altText: A child playing with colourful toys.

props.synopsis: Only 10 per cent of allegations of sexual abuse or grooming by childcare workers in Western Australia in the past six years have resulted in someone being banned from working in the industry.

title.children: Parents in shock over inaction to childcare abuse claim

image.altText: A pair of sandals sits in the foreground of an empty school dormitory filled with metal bed frames.

props.synopsis: However, more than 250 students and 12 staff members are still being held, in what is one of the worst mass kidnappings ever recorded in the country.

title.children: Fifty kidnapped Catholic school students escape captors in Nigeria

image.altText: a beach closed sign on a sandy beach, there is water behind it

props.synopsis: A body has been found in a major land and sea search following a young man being swept out to sea on the NSW Central Coast.

title.children: Body found in search for 18yo man swept out to sea after sandbank collapse

image.altText: woman is escorted to a seat inside a courtroom by a police man

props.synopsis: in 2014, Madison Geyser and an accomplice nearly stabbed a classmate to death and later told police they did so to earn the right to be Slender Man's servants.

title.children: Woman behind Slender Man stabbing in 2014 is now missing

image.altText: Illustration of scientists examining various bacteria in large pink intestines.

props.synopsis: It has long been a mystery why antibiotics reduces the effectiveness of some vaccines, but researchers believe bacteria in the gut may play a pivotal role.

title.children: Gut bacteria may explain why antibiotics make vaccines less effective

image.altText: A man shreiks and holds a chainsaw on a stage

props.synopsis: The department, established by Donald Trump and once headed up by Elon Musk, promised to slash billions from the US government but has quietly faded into the background in recent months.

title.children: 'Doesn't exist': White House disbands DOGE months early

image.altText: takaichi and Xi Jinping

props.synopsis: China's foreign minister has accused Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi of attempting to intervene militarily over Taiwan.

title.children: China says Japan 'crossed a red line' as diplomatic spat over Taiwan continues

image.altText: Arabana ranger Zaaheer McKenzie at the site of a spring.

props.synopsis: Environmentalists are calling for mining giant BHP to end its water extraction from the Great Artesian Basin when a major desalination plant is built in South Australia's north.

title.children: Calls for BHP to end water extraction before culturally significant springs are lost

image.altText: An airplane flying during the day.

props.synopsis: The first recorded bird strike, when a bird collides with an aircraft, was in the United States in 1905 but now they occur almost daily. Last year, Australia recorded the highest number in more than a decade.

title.children: Australia records highest number of aircraft bird strikes in over a decade

image.altText: A man standing in front of an Intersport store with its doors shut.

props.synopsis: Retail stores in north-west Victoria are taking their own measures to curb increasing retail crime.

title.children: Regional Victorian shops fight back against increasing retail crime

image.altText: Roslyn Grima sits on a bench, with bush behind her.

props.synopsis: In the last months of her life, Roslyn Grima was fighting in court for the right to sell her home at a tourist park to fund her cancer treatment, but died before that could happen. Now, her children will continue her battle.

title.children: Children take over court battle after cancer victim dies trying to sell home

image.altText: A man speaking to a customer at a supermarket opening.

props.synopsis: The opening of a new supermarket franchise in one of Australia's biggest inland cities has revived memories from the past when Kalgoorlie-Boulder was home to at least 35 market gardens, run mostly by European migrant families.

title.children: 'Water is key': Spud King open to growing Kalgoorlie produce

image.altText: A man in a yellow and red lifesaver uniform and lady in a suit stand on top of a sandbag wall in front of a building on a beach.

props.synopsis: Inverloch residents are "infuriated" by the Victorian government's delay in spending $3 million in federal funding to help fix coastal erosion.

title.children: Residents furious as FOI reveals failure to act on coastal erosion

image.altText: Man in hospital bed with his son sitting on bed playing cards

props.synopsis: After years of chronic pain and legal uncertainty, a new bill could finally let NSW patients like Benn drive safely with medicinal cannabis.

title.children: Former mayor backs bill to protect drivers using medicinal cannabis

image.altText: An underground rail station.

props.synopsis: The United Firefighters Union has asked the national rail safety authority to investigate the validity of a permit to run services in Melbourne's Metro Tunnel, which will begin running passenger services on Sunday.

title.children: Firefighters union questions Metro Tunnel safety permit

image.altText: An LPGA golfer sits a desk in front of a microphone and smiles as a glass trophy sits next to her.

props.synopsis: Thai world number one Jeeno Thitikul claims the biggest cheque in women's golf history, as Aussie Steph Kyriacou gets a final round hole in one at the Tour Championship.

title.children: Thai superstar Thitikul backs up with record $6.2 million golf win

image.altText: England cricket coach Brendon McCullum stands on the ground with his cap on backwards as a player watches.

props.synopsis: Brendon McCullum says England will find itself in trouble if it abandons Bazball now, with the team to double down on its aggressive tactics heading into Brisbane.

title.children: Keep calm and Bazball: McCullum plots England's Ashes turnaround
